events.name: Intro Demo of Ruby on Rails on Heroku
events.description:
I plan to give a introductory demo of setting up a Ruby on Rails website on Heroku.  I will also cover a few other features of the Heroku platform.

In the coming months, I plan to cover a variety of other cloud platforms, such as; AWS, Azure, RackSpace, Linode, etc...

If you have any questions or ideas for future meetings, I would be glad to cover other platforms.

Thanks, Dayton

events.name: Google I/O '18 Extended Event!
events.description:
Join us as we recap the major updates and announcements from this year's Google IO event. We will be viewing the Keynote plus many other talks with open discussions of each. A more detailed schedule will be provided closer to the event.

Food, drinks and Google swag will be provided to all RSVPs.

This is a joint Meetup between GDG Columbia and GDG Cloud Columbia.
events.how_to_find_us: Just left of Wild Wing Café

events.name: Google Cloud Next Extended
events.description:
Join GDG Columbia as we celebrate and learn about the exciting announcements at Google Cloud Next (https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/)! We will start off with some food and networking. We will then kick off with highlights from the event last week and transition to an open panel discussion.

Agenda to come.
events.how_to_find_us: Suite B down the alley to the left of Wild Wing Café.

events.name: DevFest '18
events.description:
**This is a free event and will include food and several door prizes.**

DevFest is a worldwide Google event focussed on empowering local communities with the latest opensource developer tools. DevFest has become a huge success here in Columbia. We hope to continue this annual tradition with emerging technologies such as Machine Learning, TensorFlow, Google Cloud, Flutter, Angular, and many more!

This year's DevFest '18 will feature 8 speakers. 4 of which will be from our Woman Techmakers Group. They will be presenting the following topics:

=> "Designing a Better App with Design Thinking"
=> "Gamefying a Project"
=> "Finding Low-Cost Learning Resources for Personal and Tech Development"
=> "Learning Elm: Functional Web Development"

The guys at 52Inc will also be presenting the latest tech topics. We will update everyone within the next day or so.
events.how_to_find_us: **Event is on the 2nd Floor**  There is a high school event on the 1st.

events.name: Tech Community Social
events.description: We will be hosting a tech community social hour at Casual Pint just before the Open Source SC event at SOCO. Everyone is invited to join us! This is a casual drop-in, so don't worry about being late. Just show up! We will then walk over to SOCO in time to support their event.

events.name: Hands On Google Cloud Next ‘19 Extended
events.description:
This Meetup will be another 2 for 1 deal!

First, we will start by giving all attendees another 30-day FREE, all-you-can-eat access to Qwiklabs, $55+ value which includes 140+ labs. You will be able to Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise. No credit card required for registration.

If this is your first time working with Qwiklabs, we will walk you through setting up your account and offer tips to get you going. You will need to bring your laptop with Google Chrome preinstalled.

Secondly, we will share content from Google’s Cloud Next ‘19 event from this past week and discuss any takeaways.

Complimentary food and beverages will be available as well as door prizes for all!

events.name: Google I/O Live Stream Party!
events.description:
Join us as we stream the Keynote and interesting sessions from Google I/O '19! Learn about the highlights, new technology, and more.

Attendees can fill out a form if they are interested in Job opportunities at Google here.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe0K820D0O7pbvZvc-CsQAQx9JLONJRC0DPTgOinaDDQB6QCw/viewform

When answering which I/O Extended event are you participating in choose "other" for the drop-down regarding event location, then add "GDG Columbia" to the "Questions or Comments?" section.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam!
events.description:
We are going to have an Intro to Flutter development, and then follow it with a series of weekly Flutter Study Jam sessions.

A more detailed timeline for the Study Jam style sessions will be announced soon. Here is a short list covering what we are planning.

> A Flutter Meetup - Installation, setup, and first apps.
> Hangout session each week following the Meetup - To discuss the next steps, assignments, and challenges to code.
> Slack channel discussions any day between the weekly Hangouts - To provide feedback, suggestions, and assistance on the assignments and challenges.

Here is a list of items to setup your Flutter environment prior to the event:
> Download and Install Android Studio (https://developer.android.com/studio)
> Start Android Studio, and go through the ‘Android Studio Setup Wizard’. This installs the latest Android SDK, Android SDK Platform-Tools, and Android SDK Build-Tools, which are required by Flutter when developing for Android.
> Go to Settings -> Plugins -> Type ‘Flutter’ in search bar under Marketplace -> Install the first result “Flutter” (it should be tagged as a ‘Language’)
> Restart Android Studio
You can also follow this guide to get setup and start playing with the framework: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Columbia
events.description:
**Attendees must register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kotlin-everywhere-columbia-tickets-64817344422

JetBrains and Google is coming together to host Kotlin Everywhere around the world - here in Columbia, 52Inc and Google Developer Group is collaborating to highlight and show Kotlin’s power across an entire stack from Mobile all the way to Backend.

We hope you will join us and enjoy this 3-hour event where we will walk through setting up your environment and go through a few JetBrains workshops! More schedule details to come!

This is an intro course, but some general knowledge is recommended. A laptop is mandatory. Certain free downloads may be required prior to the event to speed up time.

Space is extremely limited, so sign up early!

events.name: DevFest '19
events.description:
The Call for Proposals (CFP) is OPEN! Do you have something interesting to share with the community? We're looking for 45-minute presentations and 10-minute lightning talks. Details and submit your CFP here: http://bit.ly/Devfest2019

CFP closes August 19. Speakers will be announced at the beginning of September.

We should be getting the auditorium and there will be several breakout sessions. More details to come!

events.name: Flutter Interact Viewing and Holiday Party
events.description:
Flutter Interact is for UI and front-end developers hosted in NYC. GDG Columbia will be hosting a viewing party locally with a holiday theme.

Attendees will receive free coupons for a Flutter course to be distributed at the event.

Door prizes will be available as well as food and refreshments.

More details about this event will follow.

organizers.name: Dayton
organizers.bio: I have lived in Columbia for more than 34 years.  I got my BS in Statistics from USC.  I was in Scouts and I got my Eagle Scout in 1991.  I worked at The Backpacker while in college and still work there part time on occasion.

organizers.name: Tim H.
organizers.bio: Owner of the advertising agency Hill Company.  I have over 15 years experience in advertising, public relations, creative design, and web design.  I enjoy helping small to medium size businesses market themselves better.
